intro: Azorella daucoides, commonly known as the Andean parsley, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
